p: In conclusion, it appears that the plant metabolism, although always producing phenylpropanoids as main constituents, can be driven to produce propiopiperone and related compounds (CT 1-4 and 6) or compounds like ( Z)-anethole, ( E)-anethole, isoosmorhizol, and nothosmorhizol (CT 5-7) [ 86]. Table 20 summarizes the results of two reviews on P. marginatum leaf EO compositions, and of three papers not reviewed previously [ 75].
